body_html:
From the error message I'm guessing that you edited this line:

tensorflow/tensorflow/core/protobuf/config.proto

Line 21 in 31b79e4

double per_process_gpu_memory_fraction = 1;

...to something like:

  double per_process_gpu_memory_fraction = 0.2;

The 1 in the original code is not a default value. Rather, it is a protobuf field number, which controls how the protocol buffer is serialized, and it must be a unique integer. (Moreover, for backwards compatibility, it must never change.)

The default value for a double-type protobuf field is 0.0. The code for handling that is in the C++ runtime, here:

tensorflow/tensorflow/core/common_runtime/gpu/gpu_device.cc

Line 781 in 31b79e4

if (config_memory_fraction == 0) {

body:
From the error message I'm guessing that you edited this line:

https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/31b79e42b9e1643b3bcdc9df992eb3ce216804c5/tensorflow/core/protobuf/config.proto#L21

...to something like:

```protobuf
  double per_process_gpu_memory_fraction = 0.2;
```

The `1` in the original code is not a default value. Rather, it is a protobuf field number, which controls how the protocol buffer is serialized, and it must be a unique integer. (Moreover, for backwards compatibility, it must never change.)

The default value for a `double`-type protobuf field is `0.0`. The code for handling that is in the C++ runtime, here:

https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/31b79e42b9e1643b3bcdc9df992eb3ce216804c5/tensorflow/core/common_runtime/gpu/gpu_device.cc#L781
